website_summaries.verdict: An aggressive two-wheel suction cleaner that features patented tires for better climbing and is effective on pools up to 16 by 32 feet.
pros: This unit is suitable for gunite, vinyl, fiberglass, pebble, and tile, and it comes with pre-programmed steering sequences that will help the machine clean the entire pool more effectively
The self-adjusting turbine vanes help deliver maximum power to the cleaner in all circumstances
cons: If you have angled inclines and corners, there is a chance this unit could get hung up for a bit when trying to determine a course of action

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!! Love this vacuum!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing! I love this vacuum. I just got a new pool and it was filthy. This made my pool spotless in under 24 hours. I highly recommend this!!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Fill out the warranty card or you will b SOL when it breaks
customer_reviews.text: This vacc was great for 2 months. I contacted Hayward & received a "we will get back to you" email. This product has a 1 yr warranty! I sent several follow up emails & could not figure out why they were ignoring me. I understand now. I did not fill out the warranty card! Very disappointing. This is how I make my living & Hayward let me down
customer_reviews.author: Kakeswim

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum does not climb the walls.....we did everything that was recommended, we watched 3 different you tube video's on possible reasons it would not climb the walls.....we tried all 3 different sized throats, we changed the wheel revolutions from 8 rpm to 20 rpm and everything in between, we set the floats every inch from 1-30, to no avail.......this is a very poor quality vacuum....be warned or be burned....we are getting ready to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Wooten

customer_reviews.title: NOT LIVING UP TO THE HYPE
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a 5yr old Hayward Navigator based on online reviews but its not any better than my 5yr old navigator. It runs slower and can't get into pool steps. Tried different ways to tweak and make it work but to no avail. The only thing that it does that my navigator always did is that the hoses do not twist and get mangled up. It also looks very cheaply made. Am just hoping that it will last or outlast my hayward navigator (which, by the way, I did not throw away and neatly kept in the shed just in case Poolvergnuegen gives up and stops working.
customer_reviews.author: unbiasedbystander

customer_reviews.title: Wheels stop often.
customer_reviews.text: My biggest issue is that the wheels commonly stop rotating requiring me to pull the hose to get access to the unit to rotate the wheel by hand, then it works for some time but over the last 10 months it spends more time sitting still than cleaning. The suction is good otherwise. I see others with the same complaint about the wheels so buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonGuy

customer_reviews.title: DON"T BUY IT YOU WILL BE SORRY
customer_reviews.text: The cleaner is always getting jamed! I guess what the other review said about the vanes is correct. My pool is professionally cleaned weekly, this is supposed to make my life easier between cleanings but it's useless. It also never climbed the walls. I studied all of the instructions and utube videos but the problem continues and I've only had it for THREE MONTHS, but I didn't fill out warranty card- read the warranty though, it hardly covers anything, Hayward You Suck!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: stopped working after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: We bought this at the recommendation of our pool guy. 6 months later and it doesn't clean at all. We thought maybe it was the pool pump, but that has checked out to be fine.
customer_reviews.author: missmandyw

customer_reviews.title: Problem solved
customer_reviews.text: I had the old version for several years, but it would jam up every few weeks. Then I had to get a screwdriver, take it apart, find what was jamming it (if anything) and put it back together again. Finally I gave up and bought the new version. Same problem. But I just discovered there's a little finger-sized hole in the bottom. If I stick my finger in there and rotate the paddle wheels, I can get it going again without having to take it apart. It only takes about 20 seconds. Maybe if there's an acorn or something stuck in there, I'd still have to take it apart, but usually there's not. I'm so happy I discovered this!
customer_reviews.author: A reader

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum but they epxocied the connecting hose!
customer_reviews.text: Make no mistake, this is a great vacuum, I've had it 4 years now with no complaints until now. It climbed the pool walls, rarely got stuck, I have been very pleased. But this morning the hose broke right where it connects to the cleaner. 4 years in the sun will make the hose brittle, I've no problem with it breaking. The problem is they epoxied the damn hose connection to the damn cleaner! Aaaagghhh! Instead of replacing a cheap hose, now I have to replace the entire cleaner! And I see the price has gone up a few hundred dollars since I bought it. Why, why would you epoxy the hose connection?! Why?!
customer_reviews.author: Rod Sulte

customer_reviews.title: Worked good for a couple months now goes to the corner and gets stuck everyday!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a couple months. Now it goes to a corner and gets stuck there everyday. Does not turn around. Constantly just sits there and trys to move forward spinning its wheels all day in the same spot. Pump is new, clean, no blocks. Suction is the way it should be. Cleaned filter, tried to adjust suction to make it work. Nothing will make this thing work. Pretty bad for $400. How do I get a refund or replacement for a defective unit?
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Leach

customer_reviews.title: First one broke after 3.5 years, still buying another one because it's that awesome
customer_reviews.text: My first one broke after 3.5 years. The axle for one of the wheels (I have the 2X model) snapped after the unit fall off the walls so many times I guess. No way to fix this part without replacing the whole unit (I'm a little bummed about that). I leave this thing in almost 24/7, and the pool pump runs anywhere from 2-8 hours a day depending on the season. Everyone is amazed with how clean/spotless my pool is. I live in phoenix where almost every home has a pool, and I haven't seen any other brand come as close to the clean this baby can provide.
customer_reviews.author: S HEPNER

customer_reviews.title: Did NOT work on my vinyl pool
customer_reviews.text: The great reviews on this made me give it a try. I think it might work well on a regular pool but I needed it for my in ground vinyl liner pool. The wheels just couldn't get traction and when it did roll over something it would barely suck it up. I ended up returning it and getting a different type of cleaner that worked better. The new one has 4 small "feet" that seem to get a lot better traction. I read online there are special wheels you can attach for vinyl liners but I could only find one place that sold them and it was very expensive. I do NOT recommend for vinyl liner pools.
customer_reviews.author: B. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed, reviews mislead me.
customer_reviews.text: My cheap old school Kreepy always got stuck and I hated that. But where it moved, it cleaned the bottom well. This new Poolvergnuegen never gets stuck. It will pick up debris ok, but it doesn’t scrub the bottom where you can see where it’s been, like the Kreepy Krauley did. That one made like a suction as it gripped and moved. As far as my equipment, it’s the same with both cleaners! The KK would crawl clear out of the pool if I didn’t keep my ey3 on it. This thing? Pffft. I wish I could combine the strong points of the two pool cleaners.
customer_reviews.author: Jim M.

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the "scooter" style cleaners!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this cleaner for five years now, and (knock on wood) I haven't had to make any repairs / replace any parts. It does a great job cleaning my pool, doesn't get stuck in corners / on steps, etc. Much better than my experience with "scooter" type cleaners I owned prior to this one. My only complaint, but no other cleaner has managed to do any better, is that certain debris like sticks / twigs (my pool is near bamboo that sheds little twigs like crazy) tends to clog the cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: R. Helzer

customer_reviews.title: So far So good
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased and installed vacuum. No issues with installation and adjustment for suction was easy. Hope longevity is as good as most reviews say it is. Saved $175.00 ordering through Amazon versus going to Leslies Pool Supply across the street. Ridiculous what they charge for even the simplest things.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Makinen

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This item was a very good deal and it hooks up easily to my inground pool. Its very quiet unless it comes up for air (lol) as would be expected it sounds like us when we come up for water after a long stretch of swimming. I used to have a Kreepy and this guy works better, no doubt about it. I accidently purchased two thinking not realizing my first order went through. Very hassle free transaction.
customer_reviews.author: T.Worrell

customer_reviews.title: You will need to change out the wheels immediately if you have a fiberglass, drop-in pool
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our new pool, and were disappointed in it. It didn't move hardly at all around the bottom of the pool, and definitely didn't climb the walls or steps at all. Our pool maintenance guy said he had seen this a couple of times previously, and recommended we purchase new wheels. WOW! What a difference! There was nothing wrong with the pool cleaner, it was just that the hard plastic wheels it came with were not suited for our pool type. Now it works just fine. Would recommend, but don't wait to change out the wheels. It makes all the difference.
customer_reviews.author: mathbrain

customer_reviews.title: Best vacuum ever!
customer_reviews.text: We had been having issues with our pool. We had one of those jacuzzi suction things, but it would always get stuck somewhere and didn’t clean the pool. Someone recommended this vacuum, and even though it was a little pricey, it wasn’t as expensive as other vacuums out there. Well, this saved us a lot of money from having to dump chemicals as it goes all over our pool and doesn’t get stuck! We’ve had this for a while now and I’m very happy we decided to invest a little more money for something that just works!
customer_reviews.author: J.C

customer_reviews.title: It gets stuck in the corner and doesn’t climb the walls.
customer_reviews.text: I’m so sick of this cleaner. It is supposed to climb up walls, which it doesn’t. It gets in to the end corner of my pool and just continues to run in the same spot. I have a dedicated wall port and and decent pump and this has never worked properly. I’ve owned it for about 12 months and I’m done with it. Don’t buy it. And yes I read the directions and set it up properly. The wheels turn the requisite amount during the time indicated. This is just a poorly designed product.
customer_reviews.author: Doyne

customer_reviews.title: Won't climb and gets stuck very easily.
customer_reviews.text: Using in a 15000 gal pool with 310 sq ft of bottom surface to clean. I attempted to get the pool cleaner adjusted (RPM) over a two day period. Couple of major flaws in this model. 1). In 6 hours of cleaning it was never able to get up the incline from the deep end to the shallow end. 2.). The cleaner continuosly got stuck on the main pool drains and at the base of the steps in the shallow end. It's hard to imagine how this product could have a 4 star rating it's just not a legitimate product it seems almost like a toy. Good luck with Hayward Customer Service.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Cope

customer_reviews.title: without brushes to help it it wont pick up anything but leaves
customer_reviews.text: have had many pool cleaners over the past 25 years, some do OK and some do great but never cover the entire pool.This one however will cover about 98 % of the pool bottom and picks up any loose debris in its path.That being said it has no brushes on it and the suction is about 1.5 inches from the bottom therefore it just rides over green or dead algae and you can't tell it even went through. If you want this cleaner to work you better get a good brush and stir up everything on the bottom and hope the dirt is picked up before it settles again.JUST MY OPINION
customer_reviews.author: Romulus Houck

customer_reviews.title: Good for very small debris.
customer_reviews.text: Not good for leaves. A couple yes. Not much more. I have to take it apart daily during my oak tree “shedding” season.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: The reviews of this were very good so I went all in.
customer_reviews.text: The reviews of this were very good so I went all in. I always get hesitant with higher dollar items that seem so simple to make but this does the job. See video. I have a 1.5 HP motor and it pushes it really good.
customer_reviews.author: The BK Man

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. This works well with our down-sized pump (1.5 HP to 1 HP). Out of the box, we were lucky that the wheel speed is right in the middle of the recommended range. Pool sweeps tend to be good at first, then after the first repair or rebuild, they don't work as well. This one is starting out really well. I should add that I needed to add about 3 lengths of hose from our old sweep (they were still in good shape) so that the Poolvergnuegen could reach the far corner of our pool.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Besket

customer_reviews.title: Beware.  Cannot register warranty info.
customer_reviews.text: Unless you know the name and address of the pool manufacturer and installer, from 25 years ago, you are not able to register a new product. This should be against the law. I thought Hayward was a reputable company, apparently not.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: This automatic pool vacuum works awesome. We had a filter go bad on our ...
customer_reviews.text: This automatic pool vacuum works awesome. We had a filter go bad on our pool and this sucked up all the DE sand from the bottom of the pool. It also helps with the circulation down to the bottom of the pool too. The wheels are good size and it even goes up the sides of the pool. We like it so much at our rental house, we are ordering a second one for our current house. We had previously had to replace the automatic cleaners feet multiple times after being tore up on the main drain cover in the bottom of the pool. With the wheels it rolls right on over and never gets hung up anymore!!
customer_reviews.author: JDDIMI

customer_reviews.title: What's up with this?
customer_reviews.text: I asked this question not too long ago but I can't seem to find it to make sure I understood the response.. My cleaner will float about a foot above the bottom of the pool every now and then. I got the suggestion to move the floats farther up the hose. I've done that several times and the cleaner is still doing it. Anyone have an other suggestions? Other than that, I love it! The pool looks great. It's just frustrating to have to give the hose a jerk a few times a day.
customer_reviews.author: Dincwaz

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, but doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: This unit needs to be rebuilt about every 15 months here in Arizona. It does a good job until it wears out, then you'll need to have it repaired or rebuilt.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew K.

customer_reviews.title: Move along
customer_reviews.text: For starters, the box it came in looked like it had been taped and re-taped several times. After finally installed in pool, this thing made all kinds of random circles with no rhyme or reason. Passed right over several small debri with no suction at all. Don’t waste your money, invest in the powered, self contained automatic robotic filters.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Berenger

customer_reviews.title: Better than the more expensive brands.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pool vacuum to replace a worn our model that was much more expensive. My pool tech recommended this brand and he was right. This thing works much better than the old one. The old model tended to hand up on the drain covers but this one just rolls right over them. It keeps my pool really nice. I highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: R. D. Rubenack

customer_reviews.title: Clean pool!
customer_reviews.text: This thing actually cleans pretty well. It roams well and picks up everything. It's hit or miss whether it will climb walls and sometimes it will climb to the first step and get stuck for hours. It gets stuck right on the edge of the step when the vacuum is slightly turned. There's enough suction to keep the vacuum attached even though it is teetering on the edge. The wheels aren't touching the surface so they just spin suspended in water. I turn down the pressure a little to try to keep it from climbing so it doesn't get stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck K

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend at all
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for 3 months and it never really cleaned the pool sufficiently. My husband is a mechanic and took it apart and found the hole that the depris goes into is not large enough. The unit itself is made too small for our pool and our pool is pretty small. Therefore would not recommend it we have given it plenty of opportunity to work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Ilenepch

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: This automatic pool vacuum was exactly what we needed. We hook it up and forget about it - now we always have a clean pool! It does a great job across the entire length of our fairly large pool; easily climbs up the slope from the deep end into the shallow end. We’ve only had it a few weeks but so far so good. Sure beats having to vacuum the pool manually and the pool always looks great.
customer_reviews.author: CPeterson

customer_reviews.title: Works great...just not perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This does a very good job cleaning our pool. Four stars because it's not perfect. There is one corner it just will not clean, and it's not because the hose won't reach. It does not climb the walls as stated...even with changing the weights and adjusting the amount of suction. It just doesn't climb more than a few inches. However, most reviews told me that, so I am accepting that as the way things go. It is easy to clear any obstructions, though that rarely happens. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Housewife

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I was very hesitant to buy this, but it was highly recommended by my pool guy. I am so glad I took his advice. This is a great pool cleaner and does exactly what it states it does. It cleans well and is pretty thorough. Yes, there have been times when I've directed it over a specific area that I felt it missed, but in general, it's a good product for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: ecmazz

customer_reviews.title: Over priced and inconsistent results. Buyer beware!!
customer_reviews.text: Don't make mistake. I purchased this based on reviews. To say the least disappointed in this. Owned less than six months had to replace cog wheel's on side. Doesn't consistently pick up debris from bottom of pool. Will pick up leaves but not dead algae. Don't waste the money and time on this vacuum P.OS.. Going back to the knock off creepy crawly.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: Finally got it to move by maxing the pool's suction but it wouldn't climb the walls and seemed to meander around in it's own confused little orbit. I guess if I left it in there it would clean the bottom completely in a week or so. Called the customer service "help" line. That was a joke. The woman didn't know jack about the product, referred me to the frequently asked questions. Just wanted to talk with a human tech to make sure I was doing everything I could.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Boxer

customer_reviews.title: Must use a super high flow system
customer_reviews.text: If your system does not produce a HUGE amount of vacuum and flow, it will not work well. It will run ok by its self (kind of), but it will not run as advertised. And if you try and run the skimmer at the same time, even squeezed down to the lowest flow setting, it will not do much. So nope, I don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: WOULD NOT BUY AGAIN
customer_reviews.text: This pool cleaner worked great for about a year. The part that attached to the pool broke. We purchased the protection plan but that was a joke too. They said because it was in two pieces that it was caused by an accident and they won't cover the replacement. But it wasn't an accident it just wore out too quickly. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Giles

customer_reviews.title: Worst possible Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Worst possible Customer Service. Each time the waiting was about 40 min. Emailed them for support, have not heard from them so far either. Simply responded "Someone will call you". Sweeper only good for one day. Then it floats in the middle of the water. Can see sweeper wheels spin but not sweeping, move tube to push it down, it floats up again within 30 min. It serves no purpose.
customer_reviews.author: livefish

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It skipped a lot of places. One or two leaves and it would choke up. Not worth what they are asking! It’s only worth half the price!
customer_reviews.author: Dover11

customer_reviews.title: SImply the best! After 36 years as a pool owner I ...
customer_reviews.text: SImply the best! After 36 years as a pool owner I finally own a pool cleaner that works really well. This cleaner climbs walls and does not follow a routine path. The hardware is very high quality, including hoses and adapters. The suction and pattern is evident after an Arizona dust storm, best cleaner I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Jozipp

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Just make sure there are no small twigs, rocks, acorns etc on the bottom of the pool because it will suck them up and get stuck/stop moving. Easy to unclog just a bit of a hassle when your yard is surrounded by trees.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Total garbage
customer_reviews.text: If you have larger leaves or even the slightest of incline in your pool don’t buy this! Anything bigger than a 3 inch leaf will get stuck in the small suction hole and clogs the unit. Once it goes into the deep end it can’t climb out. Forget about it climbing the walls, it can’t even climb make it up a slight incline.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: After wasting good money on a robot type cleaner
customer_reviews.text: After wasting good money on a robot type cleaner, powered cleaner that lasted less than 7 months due to motor burning out. I looked for another one that I could use in my pool, and settled for this one. So far it's doing a super job, easy to setup and use, simple to remove any debris that may get stuck inside the unit (not using a leave basket to trap leaves). It just works as one should. I could not be happier with the results I've seen so far. It even picks up coarse sand that the yard maintenance crew always seem to aim at the pool. It just runs over it and the sand is gone!! Perfect!!!
customer_reviews.author: Frank Von Furstenrecht

customer_reviews.title: Best pool robot
customer_reviews.text: This is the best pool cleaning robot I have ever used. Great random path and only got stuck on a step once in two years.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Funny Name, but great product
customer_reviews.text: What a great product. This robot is fun to watch climb the wall. It's very important to get the weights right however. I did a little testing with weight placement and had the vacuum criss-crossing the bottom of the pool in no time. I have a small 16 X 9 pool with pebble tech on the sides. 3' to 5' depth. We forgot it was running and the vacuum ran for about 3 hours. Really did a good job picking up debris.
customer_reviews.author: ANORM

customer_reviews.title: I like my pool again
customer_reviews.text: I have a in-pool clean system with pop up jets, they never worked. I got this and upon initial use the suction was so strong that the hose would collapse upon itself and starved the pump. I added the larger port on the wheeled vacuum along with a bypass port (included in package) and worked extremely well. I haven't shocked my pool in a month, use to do it every 2 weeks. I don't have to spend 3hrs every weekend scrubbing it. I have a 19,000 gal pool. I love this damn contraption!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: J. L.

customer_reviews.title: The best pool cleaner
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Poolvergnuegen cleaner we have owned and love it. I would recommend this pool cleaner to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn M Pinkerton

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding pool cleaner!
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for our original Poolvergnugen, which gave excellent service over fifteen years of daily use and had finally worn-out its wheels and gears. This is an excellent design: covers the entire pool...does not get hung-up on steps, etc. (a big problem with the Barracuda), and very low maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Broke Just Beyond Return Date
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item through Warehouse Deals, Inc., through Amazon.com. as a refurbished product. It worked great for about 6 weeks, just beyond the return period. Wheels have locked up twice since then and it no longer functions. When it locks up, the hose eventually floats to the return outlet, partially blocking it. This results in air entering the system stressing the circulation pump.
customer_reviews.author: Joe V.

customer_reviews.title: Not So Good Anymore
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Poolvergnuegen cleaner. The first one worked very well so we decided to replace it with a new one that is second generation. Well, this one is a disaster. It spends must of its time doing 360 and 720 turns or stuck against the wall doing nothing. Look for something else is my advice.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A. Massaro

customer_reviews.title: This is a FANTASTIC  pool sweep.
customer_reviews.text: We had an issue with a previous Hayward design. Rocks and debris would clog it on a regular basis...it would not damage the unit, but it would not move until you took the items out of the system (sometimes this meant taking it apart). THIS UNIT IS AWESOME. Sets up quickly, great instructions, works like a charm in our larger diving pool in Arizona. Gets used a lot and while I would not have expected it to show a lot of wear yet, it seems like a very sturdy, reliable design. A great improvement over our old system (and it has not clogged yet).
customer_reviews.author: gdouglas

customer_reviews.title: Hayward navigator (a great cleaner) horrible reliability tons of moving parts always broke
customer_reviews.text: I want people to know a few things. I live in AZ and have for 32 years. For ten years I ran all three of the largest water parks in town. I know about pools chemistry and equipment. Over the past 13 years I have owned 5 suction pool cleaners. Hayward navigator (a great cleaner) horrible reliability tons of moving parts always broke. G3 Barracuda great cleaner but plastic dried out and broke in 2 years. Creepy Krawly garbage. Lastly a generic cleaner from Amazon again garbage. My pool was green. I treated it and dropped in The Pool Cleaner in 2 days BAM back to the blue. Great cleaner easy to use. We will see about reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Bappy

customer_reviews.title: Issues with fiberglass pool
customer_reviews.text: This cleaner does not suction well in a fiberglass pool. It cleans mediocre at best. I wish I could return it but I past the 30-day window and support from Hayward is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the Hayward Navigator for years, and I like this device better. It doesn't stay in one spot as much as the navigator does, and it cost less!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Cauley

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waist your money
customer_reviews.text: This was the absolute worst pool sweeper! Wouldn’t even climb the walls. This was the year to update our pool. We had a new pump put in and decided we needed a new sweeper too! We purchased this one. We quickly returned it and bought the same kind we had for many years! Pentax the great white!!! Awesome cleaner! Don’t waist your money on this one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great suction, not so great climbing.
customer_reviews.text: I call it the Pool-Roomba. The suction power is great. It cleans the bottom of my pool of debris it goes over. The problem is that it won't climb out of the deep end, into the shallow end. I have a tile surface, so this presents a challenge. I ordered a new set of tires, 896584000-938. This still didn't help. I'm a little frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: David Bunnell

customer_reviews.title: constantly getting jammed, doesn't clean well
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of these for about a year and have been struggling to get it to do anything useful. It doesn't work at all on anything but the tiniest bits of debris. It's constantly getting jammed, and I have to open it up with a Philips screwdriver, take out the turbine blades, and clean it out. Typically it needs this treatment about every couple of days.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Crowell

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my purchase of the Hayward Poolvergnuegen 896584000-013 The Pool Cleaner Automatic Suction Pool Vacuum, 2-Wheel. Directions were easy to follow and I was cleaning the pool in no time. We don't have a pool cage, so lots of leaves get blown into the pool. This vacuum really keeps up with the cleaning which leaves more time for playing.
customer_reviews.author: Marla M.

customer_reviews.title: Not Good For Every Pool
customer_reviews.text: I purchased and returned this cleaner from Amazon for a few reasons. First, the vacuum entry point was too small for my needs. Fruit from palm trees would bring this to a complete stop and it was difficult to remove them. Second, I found the build to be rather cheap in design and it appears as if it would break down easily through normal use. With the above said, I would still give the item 3 stars as it may work for you if your pool only faces modest dirt instread of any type of tree fallings.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew E. Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Fire your pool guy!!!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the Poolvergnuegen to get control of our pool. We have oak trees around our pool and no screen so we purchased the Hayward Poolvernugen and the inline filter. Our pool guy just quit, he said he was not doing pools without screens any longer. He didn't want more money he just didn't want to mess with our pool. THIS PRODUCT ROCKS!!! So far it is a rock star set-up our pool practically takes of itself. We should have fired our pool guy years ago!!! Reviewer not compensated.
customer_reviews.author: Jrljd

customer_reviews.title: So far it's an elite vacuum as far as coverage is concerned
customer_reviews.text: I tried one of the Amazon Kreepy crawler copy vacs and my pool had to be shutdown for 2 mos since there was so many leaves in it I needed a dump truck to get them out. I got this Harward and in 2 days it covered every single inch of the pool.and cleaned it up. I like this one about as much as the 3 wheeled Polaris I used for many years. I think wheeled pool vacs that can turn and change direction don't get stuck for long and cover more surface. I'm not sure how long it will last, but so far I'm liking it's service.
customer_reviews.author: Vince L.

customer_reviews.title: 4get the $$$robot....get this POOL CLEANER!!
customer_reviews.text: My pool has NEVER looked better. YOU DONT NEED A FANCY POOL ROOMBA ROBOT!!! If you can hook up a kreepy krawly...this is 200 times better!!! Granted, it takes some setup...view YouTube videos. Slow it down to 15-17rpms by adjusting the side valve on the skimmer adapter. I have a fiberglass in ground pool and this works wonders. It doesn't want to seem to claim ALL the way up the walls...but it has on occasion. I brush the walls once a week and it collects the entire bottom. A+++ love my POOL CLEANER
customer_reviews.author: Hemingway

customer_reviews.title: Buy me and put me to work quickly
customer_reviews.text: Ease of putting it to work. It works on all in ground suction based pools. Super cleans even a rough pool surface quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Pastor Rich

customer_reviews.title: Best dang pool cleaner made!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. I've owned several pool cleaners and this one is the best at a reasonable price. It is designed for pools with a suction line receptacle plumbed to the side of the pool. I don't know how well it works using a skimmer for suction.
customer_reviews.author: Russell H Reese

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: Good bye Kreepy Krawler!! This little dynamo works like a champ!! Immediate and noticeable difference! So, does not get stuck or hung up in any weird places, and actually cleans our pool....”Imagine that!!” Extremely happy with this purchase! Also, very easy to set up out of the box! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: regdog

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but works very well
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with its operation. It was not cheap, but it doesnt get stuck in corners or on steps either.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: Working well after first year
customer_reviews.text: The Poolvergnuegen pool cleaner has been performing like a champ ever since I bought it last year. Our salt water pool has the pebble-tech surface on the bottom and walls. With my old Sand Shark, it would destroy the rubber gasket on the bottom of the cleaner on an annual basis. Replacing that part regularly was a pain in the butt, and costly at the same time. I switched to the Poolvergnuegen and don't see any problems with the Pebble-tech surface destroying the rubber on the wheels. It's a pricey item, but comparable with the prices of other comparable pool cleaners. Definitely would recommend this one for your pool.
customer_reviews.author: A Roth

customer_reviews.title: Would purchase again!
customer_reviews.text: Persistence is the key with this thing. It may not get the dirt on the first or second pass, but if you leave it in the pool long enough and have it set correctly, it will maintain a great looking pool! I kinda wish the hose did not float so well, it stops all of the floating trash from making it around to the skimmer....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this pool cleaner, so far
customer_reviews.text: Half-way through the summer swimming season and I can say that we are very happy with this pool cleaner. Much better than all the previous cleaners we've had (and that's quite a few), because this one periodically turns, backs up, turns a different direction, and so on-- which keeps it from getting stuck against a wall or corner of the pool. It also does not get stuck on top of either of the two pool drains, as previous cleaners did. This one crawls right over them and keeps going. Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Bflo11

customer_reviews.title: Performance and Quality
customer_reviews.text: When I had the pool put in this is what was included in the package, after 10 years of flawless cleaning it was time to retire the unit. The price of the poolvergnuegen is a bit more than others so I chose a lesser priced unit "zodiac", after the first use i knew I had made a bad purchase, like Dad always told me "you get what you pay for, buy the best and you'll always be happy".
customer_reviews.author: R.J

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Cleaner
customer_reviews.text: The Pool Cleaner is great. We've had it for about a year now. It doesn't get stuck in corners. It reaches the shallow end of the pool with ease. It finds all of the tough spots and corners. We get some big winds and end up with a lot of junk in the pool. It might take two days (it's on 6 hours a day), but after those two days you wouldn't know anything had happened; there's not a leaf left in the pool. We've now had three cleaners and this one is hands down the best of the lot, and cheaper than the last one. The design seems simple, but the results are just want you want.
customer_reviews.author: Darmok

customer_reviews.title: Not enough hose for 15x30!
customer_reviews.text: If you are trying to decide between the 2 wheel and 4 wheel model and you have a standard 15'x30' pool definitely get the 4 wheel. I was disappointed to find out when I opened the instructions that I needed an extra 2 lengths of hose even though it stayed this was adequate for a 33' pool. It states that you need to measure from your skimmer to the opposite corner and add 1-2 hose lengths for the optimal length of hose. If I ordered the four wheel skimmer which comes with seven extra feet of hose I would have been fine without having to spend an extra $25 and still only have a 2 wheel version... WTF
customer_reviews.author: Michelle S

customer_reviews.title: Best of several brands tried
customer_reviews.text: We had a Barracuda in our pool in Arizona but it just didn't pick up the sand, leaves and dog hair. The Pool Cleaner is the best we have had (out of four brands over the years) because it is so efficient. It wanders to deep and shallow ends, is not bothered by curved walls, and does not get clogged by the little pebbles from our landscape. I know it is picking up because I have to empty the leave catcher I attached to the hose - there is always evidence of Golden Retriever in that bag. There are no negatives about this device.
customer_reviews.author: Mark H. Kolman

customer_reviews.title: Not good for steep walls
customer_reviews.text: My pool has very steep walls so this product kept falling off despite my excellent suction. Great product just didn’t work for my specific pool
customer_reviews.author: Ryan P.

customer_reviews.title: So so
customer_reviews.text: I have a pebble tech pool with cabana entry. This couldn’t climb the walls or go up ramp to shallow. I could see where it did run and cleaned those areas amazingly. But couldn’t climb steeper areas. Bought a different sweeper 1 month later.
customer_reviews.author: drc

customer_reviews.title: Best pool cleaner!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best pool vacuum I have ever owned. Bye Bye Hayward Navigator - a huge pain in the butt. Only problem is I have to clean out the basket at the pump much more often as the cleaner works so well. I have not once had to take this thing apart to pull out a leaf or little rock. It is well made and worth every penny. If you own a cleaner that you have to baby, take apart and constantly buy new parts - this is the vacuum for you!
customer_reviews.author: Mom to 2 sweetie pies

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE....DO NOT ORDER
customer_reviews.text: TERRIBLE....DO NOT ORDER! I order this PoolCleaner and it didn't work and they charged me a 20% restock fee for a non-working item. TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Holly Byrnes

customer_reviews.title: It took me a few days to figure out I could simply remove the piece that adjusts the size of the opening for this unit to make t
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Hayward navigator which was not keeping up with the leaves in my pool, it kept getting clogged. It took me a few days to figure out I could simply remove the piece that adjusts the size of the opening for this unit to make the hole bigger so the leaves wouldn't jam this one up and it has been doing a fantastic job since keeping the pool looking great
customer_reviews.author: Jack L. Hooper

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your Money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this through Amazon at the recommendation of my pool man. It worked pretty well for awhile & now has quit completely. My pool service has attempted to fix the problem but to no avail. It works for maybe an hour & then quits again. I have tried to contact Hayward but don't get any real response as to what I can do about the situation. I do not recommend Hayward products
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Purchased my new one and is even better. Once you set it at 12-13
customer_reviews.text: The only pool cleaner I will ever buy. First one finally went after many years. Purchased my new one and is even better. Once you set it at 12-13 , it will cover my whole pool floor and goes up walls. At first it was set at 14 and would come out of water!! That's how powerful it is ! I set it back a notch and it's perfect!!
customer_reviews.author: Lilly A.

customer_reviews.title: This was recommended by a friend prior to us switching to managing ...
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by a friend prior to us switching to managing our own pool. Taking care of a pool is overwhelming but this item (along with a leaf canister, recommend one with a sock so it catches more) has made things a lot simpler. Moves along with zero issue, no complaints at all. This comes highly recommended from all pool care enthusiasts and I would recommend it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Danny E.

customer_reviews.title: Great Pool Cleaner So Far
customer_reviews.text: So this pool cleaner has been great so far. It replaced an older Hayward cleaner that was constantly getting caught on the main drain and was getting worn out. Its algorithm keeps it from getting stuck anywhere in the pool. It seems to very rarely twist the hose. The cleaner will climb up the walls and suck air if you have the suction too high but that is adjustable either through your pump, your diverter or the adjustable suction orifices included with the cleaner. I cannot comment on durabilty yet because i have only had it for a few months. I willtry to update in the future.
customer_reviews.author: B Glenn

customer_reviews.title: 10 years of pool cleaners, Best pool cleaner yet
customer_reviews.text: We have owned our pool for 10 years we have had multiple pool cleaners over the years, from the 100 dollar to the 400 dollar plus variety. This cleaner has kept our pool spotless. The company that maintains our pool is the one that introduced us to the product they have had a lot of clients who have been very happy with the cleaning and the durability of the product.
customer_reviews.author: BAR

customer_reviews.title: Great, simple design
customer_reviews.text: I've had this guy for about six months, and I am very impressed so far. It is silent except when it crawls to the top of my pool, then it sounds like somebody pealed the lid off of hell for a couple of seconds. I believe I should adjust flow before the neighbors call an exorcist. The cleaner runs at remarkably little flow (about 900 RPM) when my pump is doing its many hours of low flow recirculation, and that alone makes it well worth the money. My pool has never been cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Aquaman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pool vac, though expensive for what it is. Lotta margin on these puppies. Switched from a Barracuda at the end of it's lifecycle. This requires a lot less maintenance, and travels the whole pool effectively. It does require a bit more suction than the barracuda style to be effective, particularly if you want it to climb the sides all the way. I've read that you can replace the opening on the bottom with a smaller one to increase suction, but, it didn't come with, so I haven't tried it.
customer_reviews.author: CCGK-Arizona

customer_reviews.title: Love this vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: Love this cleaner! We wasted so much money on others prior to getting this one. After watching a review on here that was completed by someone that has a Pool Cleaning Company (or works for one), we decided to give it a try. I am glad we did, is saving a lot of wear and tear on my husband's back! We haven't named it yet, working on it though :) Has to have a cute pool guy/girls name
customer_reviews.author: JustMe

customer_reviews.title: It's been in since early April and has worked wonderfully. We keep it plugged in all the time ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVING the new pool cleaner. It's been in since early April and has worked wonderfully. We keep it plugged in all the time and never have debris or green tinged water. I don't scrub our pool but once per month. We are even using less chlorine. We don't receive pool cleaning services. It was well worth the extra money for this cleaner!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Saved me money on repairs
customer_reviews.text: I finally took a change on a new pool cleaner as mine was old and I was constantly paying the pool guy for repairs. I can't believe how much cleaner the pool is now with this product. I would have bought it 2 years ago had I known. The pool guy even said he does half the work now each week. Thanks for creating an awesome pool cleaner! Well done.
customer_reviews.author: readandsing

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: We love this pool vac! My husband and I are very impressed with how well it works. Even on our stairs! After having our pool professionally cleaned we wanted a good vacuum to help keep the pool clean. The guy that drained and acid washed our pool recommended this one. Not a bit sorry we listened!
customer_reviews.author: nevadavic

customer_reviews.title: Worked Perfect Right Out of the Box
customer_reviews.text: My original 2X PoolCleaner worked superbly for almost 5 years needing just replacement tires, but it was time for a new one. Purchased this one on Amazon. Box arrived on time (even though) it was close to the holidays. Put the hoses together, attached the PoolCleaner, inserted the regulating/relief attachment into the suction fixture and it started working properly immediately. It's nice to have the PoolCleaner covering the whole pool, able to climb up into the shallow end again. It worked perfectly right out of the box. Nothing more to say other than "Thanks!".
customer_reviews.author: FL-Chris

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Pool cleaner a year ago and it keeps our pool sparkling clean. I’m very pleased with its performance.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy Q

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as my Hayward.
customer_reviews.text: While I did finally get it to work, it was only after I switched the direction of the water return jets to clockwise. It kept tangling itself up beforehand. My skimmer was designed for the water to go the other way (counter clockwise) so it's much less effective. It will kinda climb the sides, but nothing like my Hayward. When this one dies, I am back to Hayward. I'm sure I'd feel differently if I didn't have to change the direction of the water. If you have a bottom drain that is proud, this vacuum is GREAT for that. The Hayward would get stuck on mine from time-to-time. This one doesn't and actually can't get stuck.
customer_reviews.author: PozTonyPhoenix

customer_reviews.title: Saves time but unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: This pool cleaner has saved us hours of pool vacuuming but is always stopping for some reason. For 300 dollars it is much cheaper than the fancy self contained ones at the pool store but there is a catch because I lose a skimmer port when it is plugged in and it is not realizable to always continue working. I take it out look at it restart everything and it will start running again. Nothing broken but there must be something that is causing it to forget its job of vacuuming and sit at the bottom of the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Stina_Shell

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong after a year.
customer_reviews.text: I love the simple design. It’s quiet and effective. It does a great job. Great prime day purchase.
customer_reviews.author: wardamncrisman

customer_reviews.title: I so much wanted to like this because it looks so cool
customer_reviews.text: I so much wanted to like this because it looks so cool! But unfortunately, Had to return because it didn't "clean" the pool. It was great at picking up leaves. The preprogrammed moves were annoying as it would move a foot, Then spin, Then go in another direction. So it took longer to clean the pool. Also, it would get half way up the wall then fall. If you need just to pick up debris from the floor bottom, This unit is for you. But if you get some algae, It won't scrub it clean. The Barracuda is much better with scrubbing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pool looks great.
customer_reviews.text: Great pool cleaner. My pool has never looked better. I used a kreepy for many years and got frustrated with it getting stuck on a water feature. This Poolvergnuegen won't get hung up or stuck because it is wheel driven and reverses after 11 feet or so. Customer support is excellent. I called to get the larger mouth inlet because my Poolvernuegen was not climbing walls as it should. Outside of the fact that the name is hard to pronounce, everything is great with this cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Greg From Oro Valley AZ

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: This pool cleaner will not climb the sides of the pool regardless of angel of the pool or the amount of suction from the pump. It frequently gets stuck on the bottom of the pool. Spend the extra money and get the Hayward electric pool cleaner with the cleanable cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice quiet pool cleaner
customer_reviews.text: nice quiet pool cleaner. It did not climb the walls very well. I followed all the instructions to make it climb but it fails to climb to the top of the walls of my pool. I have a small kidney shape pool that is only eight feet deep in the deep end but it will not climb. I had a kreepy krawler before and it climbed just fine. I've cleaned the filter, turned up the suction to the max but it will not climb. Other than that it cleans the bottom well and does get all areas of the pool clean.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dodge

product_meta.title: Poolvergnuegen PV896584000013 Hayward 896584000-013 The Pool Cleaner Automatic Suction Pool Vacuum, 2-Wheel, White
product_meta.description: The 2x Suction PoolCleaner™ uses your existing pump and filter for power. This cleaner plugs into either your designated suction port or the skimmer. The 2x is ideal for most average sized pools. Some of the features that make 2 Wheel POOLCLEANER™ unique: SELF ADJUSTING TURBINE VANES All the POOLCLEANER™ cleaners have the patented self-adjusting turbines, which maximizes the power from the water flow. This turbine is similar to a paddle wheel with blades that are adjustable. This feature allows the POOLCLEANER™ to still move at low suction and low pressure. In addition the folding vanes of the turbine allow for the easy passage of larger debris through the cleaner. STEERING SYSTEM The 2x Suction POOLCLEANER™ has an internal programmed steering system, that causes the left wheel to periodically reverse, allowing the POOLCLEANER™ to turn and then move into another direction. For the 2x Suction POOLCLEANER™ there are five different programmed turns ranging from 90 to 450 degrees. This feature allows the POOLCLEANER™ to cover not only the deep end, but also the shallow end. The POOLCLEANER™ has no problem with uneven surfaces or strange shapes. It won’t stick in a corner, or get hung up by a main drain. ROBUST TIRE TREADS One look and you will see that the patented tire treads give the POOLCLEANER™ better climbing ability and obstacle maneuverability. The tires come with tread wear markers that show you when to replace your tires. The front tires of the POOLCLEANER™ have humps (raised treads) that allow the POOLCLEANER™ to overcome any reasonable obstacles such as the main drain and uneven surfaces. This makes the POOLCLEANER™ ideal for all pool surfaces and shapes. ADJUSTABLE SKIRT The POOLCLEANER™ has patented adjustable skirts that allow the cleaner to maintain optimal suction under the machine even when it encounters obstacles. When the POOLCLEANER™ encounters an obstacle one (or more) of the skirts will lift up (adjust) over the obstacle while maintaining suction under the cleaner. An easy way to determine if you need a 2 Wheel Suction PoolCleaner or a 4 Wheel Suction PoolCleaner is to imagine a 40 ft long pool. If the suction port or skimmer is half way (most newer pools) approx. 20 ft from one end, then the 2 Wheel Model will be sufficient. If however the suction port is all the way at one end AND you have a very deep end the 4 Wheel PoolCleaner would be better suited for your pool. The best way to describe it is that the 4 Wheel model can drag more hose. PLEASE NOTE: Special tires may be needed for certain pool surfaces such as tile, vinyl and fiberglass.
feature_bullets: 2-wheel drive cleans pools up to 16’ x 32’
Patented self-adjusting turbine vanes provide maximum power at any ﬂow and allow passage of large debris
Patented tire treads for enhanced climbing and obstacle management
Patented adjustable roller skirt optimizes suction on uneven surfaces
Multiple pre-programmed internal steering sequences ensure full pool coverage

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,144 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
